definition: (of a store, stock market etc) to open for trading/to make the first transaction of the day

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Many stock markets around the world exist a pre-opening period before trading actually occurs.
sentences.chinese: 股市開市前議價期存在於世界一些主要證券交易所。

sentences.english: The dollar declined on the open market.
sentences.chinese: 美元在公開市場上下跌了。

sentences.english: In some cases, the robbers try to sell the work on the open market.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情況下，劫匪試圖在公開市場出售。

sentences.english: Why buy on the open market?
In the first essay, we examine the information trading around open market share repurchases.
sentences.chinese: 第一篇系研究公開市場購回股票前後的資訊交易情況。

sentences.english: Market reopen after a cessation of business, clients because buy, be less than aquatic product roughhouse.
sentences.chinese: 菜市場開市，顧客們因爲買不到水產大吵大鬧。

sentences.english: The myth of open markets already does not apply to critical natural resources.
sentences.chinese: 公開市場的神話已經不再適用於關鍵性自然資源了。

sentences.english: How do open market purchases add to bank reserves anddeposits?
sentences.chinese: 公開市場購買如何增加銀行的儲備和存款？

sentences.english: HKT shares were suspended after having traded for just two minutes yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 香港電訊昨日開市後兩分鐘就停牌。

sentences.english: It was open everyday, not like Beijing's temple fairs just open on the fixed dates.
sentences.chinese: 市場天天開放，這不同與定日開市的北京廟會。

sentences.english: The Fed's open market operations are not at all neutral in allocating credit.
sentences.chinese: 美聯儲在公開市場業務裏的信貸分配根本談不上中立。

sentences.english: Longhu, for example, froze its open market land sales in the second quarter.
sentences.chinese: 例如，龍湖，凍結了在第二季度公開市場土地的銷售。

definition: lit. to hang up a plate/to open up for business/listed (on stock market)
Hang Seng index (of Hong Kong stock market)
to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
to settle a bill/to close an account
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
